marytts.util.data

Class ESTTrackReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • marytts.util.data.ESTTrackReader

  • public class ESTTrackReader
extends Object
    EST Track file reader This class interpretes a DataInputStream as an EST_Track file: it loads the whole track data in memory, and provides access methods to reach each individual frame or each individual track value.

    • Constructor Summary

      • isBigEndian

        public boolean isBigEndian()
        Returns the endianness of the file
        Returns:
        false if little endian (Intel), true if big endian (PowerPC, SPARC)

      • isBinary

        public boolean isBinary()
        Returns the mode of the file (ascii or binary)
        Returns:
        false if ascii text, true if binary

      • getClosestTime

        public float getClosestTime(double seconds)
        Get the frame time which is closest to a certain time specification. Time specifications falling after the last frame return the position of the last frame.
        Parameters:
        seconds - A time point, in seconds.
        Returns:
        (seconds - t1)<(t2 - seconds) ? t1:t2

      • getTimeSpan

        public float getTimeSpan()
        Get the time associated with the last frame
        Returns:
        time value of the last frame

      • getFrame

        public float[] getFrame(int i)
        Get an individual frame
        Parameters:
        i - index of frame
        Returns:
        the frame

      • getFrameEntry

        public float getFrameEntry(int i,
                  int j)
        Get an individual frame entry
        Parameters:
        i - index of frame
        j - index into frame
        Returns:
        the frame entry in frame i at index j

      • getMinMax

        public float[] getMinMax()
        Get the max and the min over the whole file
        Returns:
        a vector of 2 float values in the order [min,max].

      • getMinMaxNo1st

        public float[] getMinMaxNo1st()
        Get the max and the min over the whole file, excluding the first column (which can be the energy in the EST LPCs)
        Returns:
        a vector of 2 float values in the order [min,max].
